main event: A civilian observer reported seeing two bright lights moving in a circular motion in the sky near Kawanna, Indiana on September 14, 1968.
interesting points: The lights were visible for 10-12 minutes, speeding up, slowing down, and making turns before disappearing straight up.
The lights had a luminous glow and could dim and brighten the light they emitted.
The witness stopped their car and observed the lights, estimating the size of the objects to be around 50 feet in diameter.
Base personnel stated that no aircraft were in the area during the reported sighting, and the initial 'first star' observation was likely the star Arcturus.
A schematic diagram was provided showing the path and elevation of the observed phenomenon.
sighted object: two bright lights moving in a circular motion
